derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent.: symbolic; compare with peek
late Middle English: imitative; compare with cheep

encyclopedia.content: peep peep也叫呼气末正压，可增加功能残气量，使肺泡在呼气末不易陷闭，提高肺泡－动脉血氧分压差，促进肺间质及肺泡水肿的消退，从而改善肺的顺应性和肺泡通气。PEEP一般为3～10cmH2O。peep简介 PEEP(positive end-expiratory pressure)即呼气终末正压，为机械呼吸机在吸气相产生正压，气体进入肺部，在呼气末气道开放时，气道压力仍保持高于大气压，以防止肺泡萎缩塌陷。在治疗呼吸窘迫综合征ARDS、非心源性肺水肿、肺出血时起

entry.def: If you peep, or peep at something, you have a quick look at it, often secretly and quietly.

example.ex: Children came to peep at him round the doorway...
example.tran: 孩子们围在门口偷看他。

example.ex: Now and then she peeped to see if he was noticing her.
example.tran: 她时不时地偷眼看他是否在注意自己。

entry.def: If something peeps out from behind or under something, a small part of it is visible or becomes visible.

example.ex: Purple and yellow flowers peeped up between rocks...
example.tran: 岩石间隐约可见紫色和黄色的花儿。

example.ex: Here and there a face peeped out from the shop doorway.
example.tran: 商店门口从不同方向露出一张脸。

entry.def: If you say that you don't hear a peep from someone, you mean that they do not say anything or make any noise.

example.ex: You don't hear a peep from her once she's gone to bed.
example.tran: 她一睡觉，就不会发出一点儿动静。
